ai.summary: Cryne Corse Road is a 10.9 km moderate hike in the UK that follows a quiet rural road with adjoining tracks through open countryside. The route combines gentle climbs and flat sections, offering views across fields and hedgerows.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain consisting of a surfaced country road and grassy or gravel tracks. Expect uneven ground, occasional mud after rain, and occasional gate or stile crossings. Suitable footwear and a light, protective layer are recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can be changeable; bring layers and a waterproof layer. Wear sturdy boots and stay on public rights of way. Exercise caution on road sections where traffic may be present. Carry a map and compass or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a small first aid kit. Inform someone of your plan and expected return. Be mindful of livestock and other walkers, and avoid hiking in poor visibility or after dark.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a weatherproof jacket
Water and snacks (e.g., 2 L water, energy bars)
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring, summer and autumn are ideal; winter conditions can be more challenging with mud, ice and shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Cryne Corse Road Hike – 10.9 km, Moderate Difficulty (UK)
seo.meta_description: Plan your Cryne Corse Road walk, a 10.9 km moderate hike in the UK countryside. Includes terrain notes, safety tips, and essential gear for a day on country roads and tracks.
